data.title: Caesar and Cleopatra by Bernard Shaw, First Edition
data.meta_description: Three Plays for Puritans (Penguin plays) The devil's disciple; Cæsar and Cleopatra; Captain Brassbound's conversion by Bernard Shaw and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Penguin, 1946 paperback 562 First thus edition 347 pages, light scuffs to covers edges, neat name to fep with slight cracking of inner hinge but still in good tight clean reading order. Full refund if not satisfied. 24 hour dispatch. If not pictured in this listing, a scan of the actual book is available on request.

Condition: Very Good. 1979. First Edition Thus. 215 pages. No dust jacket. Pictorial cloth with slipcase. Leaflet about book inserted to front free endpaper. Black and white illustrations throughout. Binding remains firm. Pages are bright and clear with no visible markings. Boards have light edgewear with corner bumping. Mild crushing to spine, with occasional markings overall. Slipcase has light edge wear with minor markings to panels.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. 1907 First edition hardback in decorative olive green cloth, gilt titles to spine. Written in 1898 by George Bernard Shaw, a fictionalized account of the relationship between Julius Caesar and Cleopatra. Clean interior, devoid of inscriptions, marks or tears. All pages tight within binding. Covers clean, unscuffed and unfaded.

Hardback. Condition: VG+. Dust Jacket Condition: No DW. 1st Edition. Not dated but perhaps about 1946. Inscription of owner at start of book. Book is in very good plus (or better) condition with very minor signs of wear and/or age.

First edition. Profusely illustrated with colour and black & white photographs. 8vo 9 x 5.5 inches. Red decorated cloth with gilt titles. 146 pages. Inscription dated 1946 to flyleaf. No dustwrapper. Handwritten sticker to front pastedown dated 1946. Good tight-bound volume. The book of the film starring Vivien Leigh, Claude Rains, Stewart Grainger and others.

First Edition. Near fine copy in the original gilt-blocked pictorial cloth. Slightest suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. Physical description; 146 pages : including frontispiece (group portrait) illustrations, plates (part cl.) ; 23 cm. Subjects; Shaw, Bernard (1856-1950). Caesar and Cleopatra. Pascal, Gabriel (1894-1954). Caesar, Julius, in fiction, drama, poetry, etc. Bernard Shaw, George (1856-1950). Caesar and Cleopatra. Shaw, Bernard (1856-1950) Film and video adaptations. Caesar and Cleopatra. (Motion picture). Caesar and Cleopatra (Shaw, Bernard). Caesar and Cleopatra. (Motion picture). Meeting at the Sphinx (Motion picture). English drama 20th century. Film adaptations. English drama. Film adaptations. Motion pictures and literature. Drama History. Documentary television programmes. Genre; Illustrated. 1 Kg.

Hardback. First edition, 1946. Red cloth with gilt lettering to spine. VG condition; boards clean and bright, bumps to corners and spine, pages clean and tightly bound, faint foxing to fore edges in Good minus unclipped dust jacket; edgeworn with some marks, chips and small tears. Published: MacDonald & Co, 1946.

First Edition. Near fine copy in the original gilt-blocked pictorial cloth. Slightest suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. Physical description; 146 pages : including frontispiece (group portrait) illustrations, plates (part cl.) ; 23 cm. Subjects; Shaw, Bernard (1856-1950). Caesar and Cleopatra. Pascal, Gabriel (1894-1954). Caesar, Julius, in fiction, drama, poetry, etc. Bernard Shaw, George (1856-1950). Caesar and Cleopatra. Shaw, Bernard (1856-1950) Film and video adaptations. Caesar and Cleopatra. (Motion picture). Caesar and Cleopatra (Shaw, Bernard). Caesar and Cleopatra. (Motion picture). Meeting at the Sphinx (Motion picture). English drama 20th century. Film adaptations. English drama. Film adaptations. Motion pictures and literature. Drama History. Documentary television programmes. Genre; Illustrated. 1 Kg.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Him, George (illustrator). First Thus. 1st (US) edition thus, 4to, 215pp, line illustrations by George Him, brown patterned boards lettered to spine in gilt and plum; light edge spotting o/w VG Copy in Slipcase somewhat bleached out, mainly about the mouth, as of too long in a humid environment Size: 4to - over 9¾" - 12" tall.

Trade Paperback. Condition: Very Good-. First British Paperback Edition. "Major Barbara"'s date is 1945. These are 3 separately published volumes, all for the first time in paperback. "Major Barbara" has a special preface for this edition. Minor rubbing and wear; no writing in the margins, etc.

Cloth. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First Edition. Hardcover scarce Red decorated cloth Meeting At the Sphinx, by Marjorie Deans. Gabriel Pascal's Production of Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra, with Forewords by Both the Author and Producer, Bernard Shaw and Gabriel Pascal illustrated with colour and B&W plates 146pp light wear to boards corners some light foxing .(We carry a wide selection of titles in The Arts, Theology, History, Politics, Social and Physical Sciences. academic and scholarly books and Modern First Editions, Reference books ,and all types of Academic Literature.).

Hard Cover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. 1st ediiton. ND [1946]. 146pp. Gabriel Pascal's Production of Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra. 32 Colour and 32 bl/wh. photos. Portrait frontis. of Shaw and Pascal. MEETING AT THE SPHINX Gabriel Pascal's Production of Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra. With Forewords by both the Author and Producer Size: 8vo.

Stapled Pamphlet. Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. Programme to accompany the production (by Cambridge Arts Theatre Trust) of Shaw's play at the Oxford Playhouse. Cast includes: Nigel Brown/Michael Burrell/Trevor Nunn/Claire Davenport/Alun Thomas/Yolanda/Leilani Sacre/Janet McIntyre/Ian McKellen/Peter Foster/Philip Vallins/Roger Hammond/Roger Worrod/Bryan Reed/Michael Latimer/Philip Strick/Curt Dawson; play directed by Waris Hussein (assisted by Martin Baynes). First Edn., 1961; printed paper covers; [12]pp.; illus. bw. adverts. Programme notes written by Waris Hussein et al. Staples slightly rusty, but covers/pages very clean/crisp/bright. No inscriptions. Lightweight item, hence overseas customers will have SHIPPING CHARGES REDUCED subsequent to ordering. Near Fine. PRICE INCLUDES UK POSTAGE AND PACKING. Size: Approx. 208mm x 140mm. Programme.

First Edition. Fine cloth copy in a good if somewhat edge-worn and dust-dulled dust wrapper, now mylar-sleeved. Remains particularly and surprisingly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong.; 146 pages; Description: x, 11-146 p. Incl. Front. (group port. ) illus. , plates (part cl. ) 23 cm. Subjects: Shaw, Bernard, 1856-1950. Caesar and Cleopatra. Impressively illustrated with a series of photo-plates. 1 Kg.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First edition THUS, later printing. Minor shelf and handling wear, overall a clean solid copy with minimal signs of use. No extraneous markings. All pages are intact and binding is strong. Secure packaging for safe delivery. 0.2.

First edition hard back binding in publisher's original raspberry covers, gilt title and author lettering to the spine and front cover. 8vo. 9'' x 6''. Contains [xvi] 114 printed pages of text with colour plates throughout, followed by 32 monochrome illustrations from the sets. Small neat ownership marking tot he front free end paper. Very Good condition book, in Very Good condition dust wrapper with shallow rubs to the corners and edges, not price clipped 10/6. Dust wrapper supplied in archive acetate film protection, this protects and prolongs the life of the paper, it is not adhered to the book or to the dust wrapper. Member of the P.B.F.A. CINEMA, SCREEN & FILMS.

Hard Cover (with slipcase). Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Drawings By George Him (illustrator). First Thus. In green cloth with gilt titling, housed in publisher's slipcase. (light soiling at spine). Size: 4to - over 9¾" - 12" tall. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Undated; published ca. 1944. 12mo. volume in red cloth binding with gilt lettering and B&W illustration mounted on front cover. Illustrated with color and B&W photographs. This filmed production of the Bernard Shaw play featured Claude Rains and Vivian Leigh in starring roles. Contains excerpts from the production and correspondence and comments about the production. Condition: upper corners heavily bumped; inked gift inscription on 1st free endpaper; general light shelf-wear; else VG. 146 pages.
